items.tip: Beware the added sweeteners: To spot hidden sugars on food labels, look out for words that end in –ose or are a "syrup".
Better ZZZs: A good cardio workout, like a 30-minute run, can help you get more of the rejuvenating deep sleep you need to feel refreshed.
Fast asleep: If you typically conk out in less than 5 minutes, you’re likely sleep deprived.  Try sleeping 30 minutes longer each day.
Skip the salt: Half of women over 45 have high blood pressure, in large part due to sodium. Cutting back on processed foods will help.
Check yourself out: Once a month after getting out of the shower, do a skin check and look for any striking, changing spots or moles.
Stay home: If you’re truly sick, don’t go to work! Not only will you infect others, but you’ll also just prolong your own illness.
Eat smart rule: 85% of the time, choose foods that make you stronger—like whole grains for your heart and veggies for immunity.
Quit it: Smoking really kills your fertility. Women who smoke lose their eggs faster than women who don't.
Sleep in: Set your alarm for when you actually have to get up—interrupting your sleep with the snooze button will leave you groggy.
Feel it out: Get to know your breasts. It’s much easier to recognize changes if you regularly check yourself.
Get tested: Heart disease is, surprisingly, the number-one killer of women. Ask your practitioner about a cholesterol test.
To the bone: Weight-bearing exercises like walking or weight lifting for 2 ½ hours a week will keep bones strong and healthy as you age.
